programme.title: Someone They Knew with Tamron Hall
programme.desc: When an unknown assailant guns down sheriff-elect Derwin Brown shortly after winning his election, investigators suspect a political assassination, only to instead uncover an extensive trail of corruption.

programme.title: Someone They Knew with Tamron Hall
programme.desc: Lita McClinton thinks the man at her door is just delivering a dozen pink roses, but the delivery guy delivers death instead; the decades-long hunt for justice spans multiple continents before reaching a dramatic conclusion in an Atlanta courtroom.

programme.title: Someone They Knew with Tamron Hall
programme.desc: When the body of 22-year-old Misty Morse is found floating in the Indian River, police suspect one of her many boyfriends; with only a piece of nautical rope and a strip of duct tape to go on, an unusual kind of DNA could actually break the case.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.sub-title: The Pain Of A Dying Mother
programme.desc: Before she reached out to the defendant to end her suffering from ALS, Frederick communicated with her daughter by typing into a telephone for the deaf because her muscles in her arms and hands had diminished.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: Merian Frederick's daughter told the jury about her mother's ALS; Frederick and Dr. Ali Khalili went to Kevorkian for help; the daughter of Merian Frderick told jurors about the day her mother was going to die.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: The medical examiner who did the autopsies of both Dr. Ali Khalili and Merian Frederick testified about physician-assisted suicide; this was Doctor Jack Kevorkian's second trial over that practice.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: The widow of one of Doctor Jack Kevorkian's patients testified about what her husband went through in his final days; Dr. Ali Khalili, a rehab doctor, was suffering from bone cancer.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: The jury saw the full unedited video of Dr. Jack Kevorkian meeting with Dr. Ali Khalili; Khalili had bone cancer and wanted a way to end his pain; jurors heard from Doctor Ali Khalili, in his own words.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: A rehab doctor who helped patients with pain and injury, was suffering himself; Dr. Ali Khalili came to grips with his reality of bone marrow cancer.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: The state put mulitple family members on the stand during Doctor Jack Kevorkian's trial to paint a picture of what life was like at home for Dr. Ali Khalili and Merian Frederick.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: Merian Frederick's son was there when his mother passed away from carbon monoxide poisoning; he testified in Doctor Jack Kevorkian's trial, where the doctor was accused of helping Frederick and doctor Ali Khalili take their own lives.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: Scott Nelson's attorney brought in details of the neurological evaluation he underwent. While he was in jail on murder charges for the death of Jennifer Fulford, several mental health experts and medical doctors evaluated him for any and all issues.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: Jurors learned more about Scott Nelson's apparently declining health which his defense wanted to highlight as a mitigating factor in his role in killing Jennifer Fulford.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: Scott Nelson was in and out of prison throughout his adult years. A good chunk of that was in federal prison. He was convicted on charges of kidnapping, assault, substance abuse and bank robbery.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: Life as a federal prison inmate was the focus of the Defense's case to jurors. A prison expert, who reviewed Scott Nelson's records of his many behind bars, testified on the numerous incidents he had while being incarcerated.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: Scott Nelson's mental health evaluation would be his defense's best evidence to spare his life from death row. On the stand was forensic psychologist Dr. Valerie McClain who evaluated the defendant.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: The forensic psychologist on the stand went through her results of Scott Nelson's mental health evaluation.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Everybody was in shock the day John O'Keefe died according to Brian Higgins, who was under cross examination.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: Getting Rid Of Cellphone And SIM Card
programme.desc: Karen Read's attorney accused a State witness of changing his statements to law enforcement.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: Brian Higgins Wraps Up His Testimony
programme.desc: An ATF special agent admitted that he got rid of cell phone records of the texts he made in the weeks and even hours leading up to the death of John O'Keefe.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: The doctor who pronounced John O'Keefe dead at the hospital testified. Emergency room physician, Dr. Justin Rice, told jurors how John O'Keefe lost his life in a blizzard.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Pathologist from the hospital where John O'Keefe was pronounced dead took the stand.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: The State was not finished breaking down the testing done on Karen Read when it came to how much alcohol was in her system.

programme.title: Someone They Knew with Tamron Hall
programme.desc: Small-town plumber John Cataneo fixes other people's homes for a living, until death came knocking on his front door; to find out who wanted him dead, police investigate the contents of Cataneo's own home, and get the leak they need.

programme.title: Someone They Knew with Tamron Hall
programme.desc: When a well-respected psychiatrist and his adult son are killed as they sleep, police are baffled by the apparent randomness until an arrest in an unrelated crime leads them to the least likely of suspects.
